title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1.13 - Executive Order No. 13: [Continuing Order No. 12.]
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1.13 - Executive Order No. 13: [Continuing Order No. 12.]
State Regulations
WHEREAS, On August thirtieth, nineteen hundred sixty-one, I, Nelson A. Rockefeller, Governor of the State of New York, did make a certain
order appointing: S. Hazard Gillespie, Chairman; Mrs. Arthur C. Aulisi; Kenneth

Bartlett; John A. Coleman, Sr.; Manuel Goldman; Nelson C. Jackson; Gustave L. Levy; Baldwin Maull; Joseph Monserrat; Mrs. James S. Seymour; and David

Sullivan as Commissioners generally to study, examine, investigate, review and
make recommendations with respect to certain matters concerning State and local
activities relating to the aid, care and support of the needy, all of which are
more particularly described in said order and which order is hereby
incorporated herein and made a part hereof as if set forth herein in full; and
WHEREAS, it appearing to be in the public interest that the
study, examination, investigation and review conducted pursuant to said order
should be continued; NOW, THEREFORE, Pursuant to Section
6
of the Executive

Law, I have extended and by these presents do extend the appointment of S. Hazard Gillespie, Chairman; Mrs. Arthur C. Aulisi; Kenneth Bartlett; John A. Coleman, Sr.; Manuel Goldman; Nelson C. Jackson; Gustave L. Levy; Baldwin

Maull; Joseph Monserrat; Mrs James S. Seymour; and David Sullivan for the
purpose of completing the study, examination, investigation and review
heretofore undertaken pursuant to, and with the powers, authorities and duties
contained in said order dated August thirtieth, nineteen hundred
sixty-one. Signed: Nelson A. Rockefeller

Dated: January 1, 1963

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
1.13

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
